extendedIngredients.name: cheese
extendedIngredients.originalString: 8 oz cheese (use a cheese that is compatible with fruit; I like Brie, Goat Cheese or Cream Cheese).
metaInformation: with fruit; i like brie, goat cheese or cream cheese).

extendedIngredients.name: maple syrup
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2-4 Tbsp Sugar or Maple Syrup to taste

recipes.title: Omelets with Goat Cheese and Raspberries

winePairing.pairingText: Omelet works really well with Sparkling Wine. Even if you aren't making mimosas, sparkling wine is great with eggs for two reasons. One, if you're eating eggs early in the day, sparkling wine has less alcohol. Secondly, it cleanses the palate, which is important since yolk is known to coat the palate. You could try Banfi Rosa Regale Brachetto. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.8 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 21 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Banfi Rosa Regale Brachetto
productMatches.description: Festive cranberry in color with an aromatic bouquet with hints of raspberries, strawberries and rose. A fresh raspberry taste, with crisp acidity, enticing the palate with an initial softness, graduating to a round and luscious finish.

recipes.instructions: Beat the eggs in a medium bowl with a fork until well blended; add the water and beat just to incorporate.Melt the butter in a cast iron or non stick skillet; skillet should be hot; pour in the eggs.Immediately turn down the heat to low; cover and do not open the pan for 5 minutesWhen the eggs appear cooked (the center is not jiggly), spread or crumple half the cheese on one side of the omelet. Cover and turn off the heat.Let set for one minute or as long as it takes to melt the cheese; then fold the omelet in half to encase the cheese inside the egg.Remove enough fresh berries to garish the tops of the omelet.Put the remaining fruit into a processor or use a stick blender and blend until smooth. Strain if desired to remove seeds.Add either sugar or maple syrup to taste to sweeten. Cut in half, top with fresh fruit, fruit sauce and garnish with powdered sugar if desired.

steps.step: Beat the eggs in a medium bowl with a fork until well blended; add the water and beat just to incorporate.Melt the butter in a cast iron or non stick skillet; skillet should be hot; pour in the eggs.Immediately turn down the heat to low; cover and do not open the pan for 5 minutes
When the eggs appear cooked (the center is not jiggly), spread or crumple half the cheese on one side of the omelet. Cover and turn off the heat.
Let set for one minute or as long as it takes to melt the cheese; then fold the omelet in half to encase the cheese inside the egg.
Remove enough fresh berries to garish the tops of the omelet.
Put the remaining fruit into a processor or use a stick blender and blend until smooth. Strain if desired to remove seeds.
Add either sugar or maple syrup to taste to sweeten.
Cut in half, top with fresh fruit, fruit sauce and garnish with powdered sugar if desired.
